title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box
notes: Everything looks OK

title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box
notes:
Overall played well w/o errors or crashes.
Performance lower than on Windows, have to decrease graphics quality.
XBOX 360 controller is not detected automatically, have to configure it manually.
On-screen buttons are just numbers instead of ABXY, LT/RT, etc.
Player's name is "steamuser" instead of Steam user's name.
Controller's force feedback is very weak, it is fun than it's strong like on Windows.
Have not tested on-line functions and web-cam.
specs: Core2 Duo E8200 / GeForce GTX 750 Ti

title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box
notes: ON FIRST START UP HAD BLACK SCREEN. RAN GAME CONFIG UTILITY BEFORE RESTARTING THEN GAME WAS FINE. PLAYED FOR OVER 80 MINS WITH NO ISSUES. GAMEPAD NOT RECOGNISED UNTIL MANUALLY ASSIGNED GAMEPAD BUTTONS TO CONTROLS. AFTER THAT WORKED AS PER NORMAL.

title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box
notes: Worse performance than on Windows (On Windows it ran at Medium/High at 40-60 fps, on Linux I had to bump it down to Low for 40-60 fps). On first startup of the game it ran worse (20-30 fps) but after a few minutes of playing and restarting the game it ran better (10 to 20 fps better). I get some stutters (100-500 ms of lag) every 5 to 10 sec (playable but annoying). Controller is not detected automatically but could be manually assigned in the settings. Name in game is 'steamuser'. Audio is a tiny bit "crackly".

title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box
notes: No gamepad input
xbox wireless controller needed configuring in game settings but everything else is perfect

title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box

notes: Runs fine, perfectly playable and I will be doing. Fairly frequent quick stutters in FPS. Manual controller mapping is no big problem. Running Steam under wine, removes these problems all together.
title: Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon HD 7800 Series (PITCAIRN, DRM 3.26.0 AMD 18.30 , 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: It's playable but it stutters quite a bit. Turning down the graphics quality helps a bit. Had to map my wired xbox 360 controller manually in-game & navigate menus with the keyboard.
